bibl.title: Salfest S. Sylvester v. Stener A. Wenaas. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In re SALFEST S. SYLVESTER for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
STATE OF WASHINGTON County of King.
div1.p: JOHN B. HART being first duly sworn, upon oath deposes and says: I am one of the deputy prosecuting attorneys in and for King County, Washington; that the respondent herein and the State of Washington make this application for the reason that it is the intent, so affiant has been informed and believes, of the authorities of the state of North Dakota to prepare new requisition papers so as to extradite the petitioner from this state to that state; that the said petitioner is a fugitive from the justice of the state of North Dakota, he having committed the crime of embezzlement, amounting to several hundred dollars; that the means of knowledge that this affiant has of the intent of the authorities of North Dakota to make out new extradition papers and demand the return of said petitioner to that state are based on conversations had with the respondent Wenaas in this case, who heretofore has been in this cause the accredited agent of the State of North Dakota; also on two telegrams received on July 3rd, 1899, by Mr. James F. McElroy, prosecuting Attorney of King County, one being from the Governor of the State of North Dakota, which is hereto attached and made a part hereof, the other being from one J. F. Selby who is the Prosecuting Attorney of Traill County, North Dakota, which is hereto attached and made a part hereof.

Affiant further states that it is alleged in various papers hereunto exhibited in court that the crime with which said petitioner is charged in North Dakota is alleged to have been committed in said Traill County, North Dakota.

Affiant further believes that the period of ten days from the date hereof will be sufficient time within which to allow the authorities of North Dakota to prepare new requisition papers and procure the warrant from the Governor of this state for the extradition of the petitioner to the state of North Dakota.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 5thday of July, A. D. 1899.
div1.ab: Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington. Northern Division.
In re Salfest S. Sylvester for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
FILED IN THE U. S. CIRCUIT COURT, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
James F. McElroy. Attorney for Respondent.
